header.title: LIBER COLLEGII SANCTI SUB FIGURA CLXXXV
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Initiatory Order Manual

central_thesis: This document meticulously outlines the hierarchical, structured path of the A.'.A.'. Outer Order, from Probationer to Adeptus Minor, detailing the specific tasks, studies, and oaths required for each grade, all systematically designed to prepare the aspirant for, and culminate in, the attainment of the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel.

structure_content.summary: The Probationer undertakes a minimum one-year period of study, reading Liber LXI and Liber LXV (memorizing a chapter), engaging in practices of 'Scientific Illuminism,' and choosing a magical motto. The core task is to begin 'The Great Work' by obtaining scientific knowledge of one's own being, under the guidance of a Neophyte.

The Neophyte progresses for at least eight months, studying Liber VII, Liber O (in all branches), and Liber H, passing tests like 'The Powers of the Sphinx' and 'Journeying in the Spirit Vision.' They also construct a Magic Pentacle. The oath commits them to controlling their nature and powers, serving Probationers, and being admitted to the Zelator grade, under the guidance of a Zelator.

The Zelator, advanced by authority, studies Liber CCXX, Liber XXVII, Liber DCCCXIII, and Liber HHH (meditations). They master practices from Liber E, focusing on posture and breathing, and construct a Magic Dagger. The oath emphasizes control over 'the foundations of my own being' and service to Neophytes, under the guidance of a Practicus.

The Practicus, advanced by authority, delves into Qabalah, studying Liber DCCLXXVII, Sepher Sephiroth, Liber III Chapter I, Liber XXVII, Liber XVI, and Liber HHH (S.S.S. meditation). They construct a Magic Cup. The oath aims at controlling 'the vacillations of my own being' and service to Zelatores, under the guidance of a Philosophus.

The Philosophus, advanced by authority, studies Liber CLXXV, Liber III Chapter II, Liber V (meditations), Liber O Chapters V-VI, and Liber DCCCXIII. Practical tasks include the construction and consecration of Talismans, Evocation, and a Magic Wand. The oath focuses on controlling 'the attractions and repulsions of my own being' and service to Practici, under the guidance of a Dominus Liminis.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Task of a Dominus Liminis
structure_content.summary: The Dominus Liminis, advanced by authority, studies Liber III Chapter III and Liber Mysteriorum, meditates on accumulated knowledge, and undertakes an office in a Temple of Initiation. They construct a Magic Lamp. The oath commits them to controlling 'the aspirations of my own being' and service to Philosophi, under the guidance of an Adeptus Minor.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Task of an Adeptus Minor
structure_content.summary: The ultimate task of the Adeptus Minor is 'to attain to the Knowledge and Conversation of his Holy Guardian Angel.' The oath formalizes this supreme commitment and includes service to lower grades, marking the culmination of the Outer Order's work.

key_concepts.definition: A highly structured magical order founded by Aleister Crowley, emphasizing individual spiritual and magical attainment through a progressive system of grades and initiations, outlined in detail in this document for its Outer Order.

The overarching spiritual and magical objective of the A.'.A.'. system, explicitly defined as 'to obtain a scientific knowledge of the nature and powers of my own being,' culminating in the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel.

The ultimate individual spiritual entity, often considered the 'higher genius' or true divine self, whose 'Knowledge and Conversation' is the central, supreme goal of the A.'.A.'. Outer Order grades as outlined in Liber CLXXXV.

The methodological approach of the A.'.A.'., emphasizing systematic, empirical, and experimental practice in magic and spiritual development, akin to the scientific method, as foundational for Probationers.

key_concepts.term: Liber O (Liber O vel Manus et Sagittae sub Figura VI)
key_concepts.definition: A foundational practical manual for A.'.A.'. training, covering essential magical exercises such as Asana, Pranayama, assumption of God-forms, vibration of divine names, and various banishing and invoking rituals, crucial for the Neophyte grade and beyond.

A system of Jewish mysticism and esoteric knowledge, extensively integrated into Western occultism. It forms a significant part of the Practicus grade's curriculum, including studies of Liber DCCLXXVII and Sepher Sephiroth.

key_concepts.term: Magickal Weapons (Pentacle, Dagger, Cup, Wand, Lamp)
key_concepts.definition: Specific ritual implements that aspirants are required to construct at various grades (Neophyte, Zelator, Practicus, Philosophus, Dominus Liminis respectively) according to instructions in Liber A, symbolizing increasing mastery over elemental and energetic forces.

key_concepts.term: Mystery is the enemy of truth
key_concepts.definition: A core A.'.A.'. tenet, appearing in the 'Task' for each grade, compelling aspirants to openly proclaim their connection to the A.'.A.'. and its principles, counteracting secrecy and encouraging transparency in their magical path.
The overall context for the 'Tasks and Oaths' presented in Liber CLXXXV, indicating that this document is a component or elaboration of a larger framework for the A.'.A.'. grading system.

practical_system.description: The A.'.A.'. system, as detailed in Liber CLXXXV, constitutes a highly organized, hierarchical initiatory path from Probationer (0=0) to Adeptus Minor (5=6). Each of the seven grades is characterized by a set of prescribed tasks, required readings (primarily Aleister Crowley's 'Holy Books' or 'Libers'), practical magical exercises, and a formal oath. Progression is linear and merit-based, with each grade requiring the completion of specific objectives, the attainment of certain states of consciousness, and the demonstration of mastery over defined skills, overseen by a mentor from a higher grade. The system emphasizes self-discipline, unwavering dedication, and a 'scientific' approach to validating spiritual experiences. The ultimate practical objective is the systematic dismantling of the ego and the cultivation of awareness leading to the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel.
tools: Magic Pentacle (constructed by Neophyte according to Liber A)
Magic Dagger (constructed by Zelator according to Liber A)
Magic Cup (constructed by Practicus according to Liber A)
Magic Wand (constructed by Philosophus according to Liber A)
Magic Lamp (constructed by Dominus Liminis according to Liber A)
rituals: Reading and memorizing specific 'Libers' (e.g., LXI, LXV, VII, CCXX, DCCCXIII, XXVII, DCCLXXVII, CLXXV)
Liber O practices: Asana, Pranayama, assumption of God-forms, vibration of divine names, banishing and invoking rituals (Neophyte, Philosophus)
Tests of 'The Powers of the Sphinx' (Neophyte)
Practices of 'Journeying in the Spirit Vision' (Neophyte)
Examinations in Liber E (Posture and Breathing) (Zelator)
Accepting an office in a Temple of Initiation (Dominus Liminis)

relevant_quotes.text: BEING THE TASKS OF THE GRADES AND THEIR OATHS PROPER TO LIBER XIII. THE PUBLICATIONS OF THE A.. A... IN CLASS D FROM A TO G
To prosecute the Great Work: which is, to obtain a scientific knowledge of the nature and powers of my own being.
Let him be mindful that the word Probationer is no idle term, but that the Brothers will in many a subtle way prove him, when he knoweth it not.
Let the Adeptus Minor attain to the Knowledge and Conversation of his Holy Guardian Angel.
Reverence, duty, sympathy, devotion, assiduity, trust do I bring to the A..A.. and right soon may I be admitted to the knowledge and conversation of the A..A..!
He shall everywhere proclaim openly his connection with the A..A.. and speak of It and Its principles (even so little as he understandeth) for that mystery is the enemy of truth.
When authority confers the grade, he shall rejoice therein; but beware, for that that is his second departure from the middle pillar of the Tree of Life.
This paper is to be returned to the Chancellor of the A..A.. by the Neophyte introducing through his Zelator.

critical_analysis.relevance: Liber CLXXXV is a cornerstone document for understanding the practical and philosophical backbone of the A.'.A.'. order, a seminal force in modern Western Esotericism. It outlines a systematic, progressive curriculum designed for individual magical and spiritual development, distinctly emphasizing empirical verification ('Scientific Illuminism') rather than blind faith. Its structured approach influenced subsequent occult orders and solo practitioners, providing a detailed roadmap to the Great Work, culminating in the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary audience is aspiring initiates seeking a rigorous and structured path within the Thelemic tradition and the A.'.A.'. order. Beyond practitioners, it is invaluable for academic researchers, historians, and students of Western Esotericism, providing direct insight into the operational mechanics and pedagogical philosophy of one of the most influential magical organizations of the 20th century.
